title: Particle motion - crossing an axis location

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="negative 4 less or equal than t less or equal than 4"><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared plus 2 t minus 15"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 t plus 1"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, at which of the following locations does the particle cross the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis?

choices.label: The point <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses 0 comma 7 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> only

The point <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses 3 comma 7 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> only

The points <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses 0 comma 7 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses 0 comma negative 9 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

The points <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses 3 comma 7 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses negative 5 comma 9 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: The point <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses equals open parentheses 0 comma 7 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> only

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
